snippet: Sanctions were imposed on a lawyer and his client, a woman whose husband died on Sept. 11, saying anti-Semitic references were made in court filings.
abstract: Sanctions are imposed on lawyer Bruce Leichty and his client Ellen Mariani, woman who filed wrongful death lawsuits after her husband died on one of the planes to hit the World Trade Center; Federal Appeals Court judge cites antisemitic references that were made in court filings, calling documents nothing more than a vehicle for making personal slurs against a judge.
lead_paragraph: Sanctions were imposed on a lawyer and his client, a woman whose husband died on Sept. 11, saying anti-Semitic references were made in court filings.

headline.seo: Slurs Were Used in a Filing Tied to 9/11, Court Says
headline.main: Court Penalizes a Lawyer Over Slurs in a 9/11 Filing
headline.print_headline: Court Penalizes a Lawyer Over Slurs in a 9/11 Filing
